org.codemonkey.util
Class DecoderUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.util.DecoderUtil

public final class DecoderUtil
extends Object

Helper utility for interpreting encoded strings, including complete reflective decoding of objects. In effect this behavior mimics serialization (see Serializable), except that the result is a hyper portable and ultra small serialized string.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema

Field Detail

VALUE_SEPERATOR

private static final String VALUE_SEPERATOR
Separates the length of a value from its value. Needed to be able to occupy multiply characters for denoting the value's length.

See Also:

private static final String ENCODED_NULL
The null notation for datagrams.

Constructor Detail

DecoderUtil

public DecoderUtil()
Method Detail

genericDecodeList

public static <T> List<T> genericDecodeList(StringBuilder encodedString,
                                            Class<T> _class)
Decodes a datagram into a list of objects, where the first token should be the number of encoded objects. For each count a decodable object DatagramDecoder or 'common' type is reflectively being instantiated, which in case of a DatagramDecoder then becomes responsible for decoding a nested part of the encoded datagram value.

Type Parameters:
T - Any subtype that is either a DatagramDecoder type or a common type (String, Number, char etc. etc.).
Parameters:
encodedString - The datagram encoded value, starting with the number of items, where each item may consist of a group of items (in case of a DatagramDecoder).
_class - Any subtype that is either a DatagramDecoder type or a common type (String, Number, char etc. etc.).
Returns:
A list of decoded objects, which can be instances of a DatagramDecoder implementation, or a list of common objects (a list of Boolean values for example).

reflectiveDecode

public static void reflectiveDecode(Object subject,
                                    StringBuilder encodedString,
                                    Class<?> specificClass)
Decodes a datagram reflectively by inspecting the given Class for all it fields, which are assumed to take part in the decoding process. The values to apply to these fields are determined by extractValues(StringBuilder, int).

This works only if the fields are encoded in the same order, which is only guaranteed by reflectively encoding using reflectiveDecode(Object, StringBuilder, Class)

Parameters:
subject - The object that reflectively receives all the values found.
encodedString - The encoded datagram value.
specificClass - The specific type that should be introspected for its fields.
See Also:
convertValue(String, Class)

convertValue

private static Object convertValue(String value,
                                   Class<?> targetType)
Performs a manual check for SimpleSerialization to convert the value, otherwise a reflection sweep is performed to convert the value, if possible at all.

Parameters:
value - The value to convert.
targetType - The type the value should be converted to.
Returns:
A converted value using SimpleSerialization or reflection.
See Also:
Used to find the right converted value for the encoded datagram token.

extractValue

public static String extractValue(StringBuilder encodedString)
Shortcut method that calls extractValues(StringBuilder, int) with argument of 1 and returns the first (and only) result value.

Parameters:
encodedString - A datagram encoded string of which to interpret a single value from.
Returns:
The first singular encoded value of the given datagram encoded string.
See Also:
extractValues(StringBuilder, int)

extractValues

public static List<String> extractValues(StringBuilder encodedString,
                                         int count)
Extracts a given number of values from the datagram and returns the remaining encoded values.

Parameters:
encodedString - The datagram that contains at least the expected given number of encoded values.
count - The expected number of encoded values.
Returns:
The datagram minus the 'deserialized' values. Does consider lists sizes!

countNext

public static int countNext(StringBuilder encodedString)
Returns the encoded length of the next token and removes this indication so that the encoded string starts with the token for further processing.

Parameters:
encodedString - The string containing the datagram encoded values including length notations.
Returns:
The length of the next token.
